info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Nottoway, western Amelia and southwestern Powhatan Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darlington Heights, or near Hampden Sydney, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hampden Sydney and Hampden Sydney College around 1050 PM EDT. Farmville and Longwood University around 1100 PM EDT. Rice around 1105 PM EDT. Guinea Mills around 1115 PM EDT. Cumberland around 1125 PM EDT. Sunnyside, Tobaccoville, Morven and Ballsville around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Briery, Oak Forest, Twin Lakes State Park, Winterham, Hawk and Kingsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
